description: When the user feels spiritually distant, doubtful, or disconnected from Allah — needing reminders, reconnection, and divine reassurance.

primary.text_en: Say, 'O My servants who have transgressed against themselves [by sinning], do not despair of the mercy of Allah. Indeed, Allah forgives all sins.'
primary.text_ar: قُلْ يَـٰعِبَادِىَ ٱلَّذِينَ أَسْرَفُوا۟ عَلَىٰٓ أَنفُسِهِمْ لَا تَقْنَطُوا۟ مِن رَّحْمَةِ ٱللَّهِ...
primary.explanation: Even your darkest doubts are no match for Allah's mercy.

primary.text_en: O you who have believed, believe in Allah and His Messenger...
primary.text_ar: يَـٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوٓاْ ءَامِنُوا۟ بِٱللَّهِ وَرَسُولِهِ...
primary.explanation: Renewing faith is part of the journey.

primary.text_en: Has the time not come for those who have believed that their hearts should become humbly submissive at the remembrance of Allah...?
primary.text_ar: أَلَمْ يَأْنِ لِلَّذِينَ آمَنُوٓاْ أَن تَخْشَعَ قُلُوبُهُمْ لِذِكْرِ ٱللَّهِ...
primary.explanation: The door is always open — return anytime.

primary.text_en: So surely with hardship comes ease. Indeed, with hardship comes ease.
primary.text_ar: فَإِنَّ مَعَ ٱلْعُسْرِ يُسْرًا * إِنَّ مَعَ ٱلْعُسْرِ يُسْرًا
primary.explanation: Your trial is not a sign of rejection — but purification.

primary.text_en: This is the Book about which there is no doubt — a guidance for those conscious of Allah.
primary.text_ar: ذَٰلِكَ ٱلْكِتَـٰبُ لَا رَيْبَ ۛ فِيهِ ۛ هُدًۭى لِّلْمُتَّقِينَ
primary.explanation: Anchor your heart in revelation when doubt shakes you.

primary.text_en: Faith wears out in your hearts as clothes wear out, so ask Allah to renew faith in your hearts.
primary.explanation: It’s normal to feel low — ask for renewal.

primary.text_en: Whoever loves for Allah’s sake, hates for Allah’s sake, gives for Allah’s sake... has perfected faith.
primary.explanation: Purify your intentions — and watch your faith grow.

primary.text_en: No one of you truly believes until he loves for his brother what he loves for himself.
primary.explanation: Faith is deeply tied to compassion.

primary.text_en: Faith has over seventy branches... the highest is saying ‘La ilaha illallah’.
primary.explanation: Start small — even a phrase can ignite the heart.

primary.text_en: The sweetness of faith is found when Allah and His Messenger are more beloved to you than anything else.
primary.explanation: Faith is not just belief — it’s love.

duas.text_en: O Allah, renew faith in my heart and keep me firm upon it.
duas.text_ar: اللَّهُمَّ جَدِّدِ الْإِيمَانَ فِي قَلْبِي وَثَبِّتْنِي عَلَيْهِ
duas.explanation: When faith feels weak, ask the One who owns hearts.

duas.text_en: O Turner of hearts, keep my heart firm on Your religion.
duas.text_ar: يَا مُقَلِّبَ الْقُلُوبِ ثَبِّتْ قَلْبِي عَلَىٰ دِينِكَ
duas.explanation: The Prophet ﷺ repeated this often — so should we.

reflection: Moments of doubt are not the end — they’re a chapter in your story. Even the companions had moments of weakness. What matters is returning. Faith is like the moon: it wanes, but always returns to full. Keep walking — the light will meet you again.
